website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced device for those who want quality CO detection. Digital display and seven-year warranty are excellent features for the money.
pros: May be plugged into a wall socket or operated via battery
cons: Some questions about accuracy of the manual vs. what is found online

customer_reviews.title: No Ongoing Digital Readout
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to discover "digital" display does not display a running CO level, 0 or otherwise. It only displays a digital value if the unit is tested or if an actual CO alert is sounded. This stinks since I specifically purchased the unit to display a running value for my garage. Advertised "digital displays" does not emphatically state continual display, but there is that implication. Won't buy again. **Addendum...unit packaging states..."Digital Display, Clearly Illuminates hazard levels." This is hedging by the manufacturer. It should have added to the above phrase..."...with user intervention." I.e., the buyer will NOT "clearly see the hazard levels" unless he/she presses the display button. Otherwise, the display is BLANK! Very poor marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly C

customer_reviews.title: These things work and they saved our lives.
customer_reviews.text: Last year, on a cool night, we entered our home. While all were fast asleep around 2am, there was a piercing noise. We scrambled trying to figure out what it was. Finally recognized it coming from behind a dresser. It was an older model of this carbon monoxide detector that we had totally forgotten had been plugged in there for years. You see that night, the old 14 year furnace decided to die and releasing Carbon Monoxide into the house. Our mother said, "oh we could have woken up dead". So we of course replaced it with this new model.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiOne

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL!!!!! FALSE READING!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’d be wary about buying this product. I got two (one for upstairs and downstairs) both read 400 ppm and warned me to leave the house. I tested the devices several times and it all read 400. I called 911 to let them know about my CO level in my house. When the firefighters came, they checked my co level and it was 0.....so not only do I feel like a complete idiot for calling 911 and wasting EMS’ time, but this product did not work properly.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: won't buy it any more.
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to work for 7 years since production date. I bought two of then on Jan 2 of 2018. One started malfunctioning not even in use for one year. I just started to use the second one and it is beeping intermittently, and the attached photo is the weird unrecognizable thing on the tiny screen. I bought two dated 2014 in 2014 at Amazon . One is still working and one was bad at least two years ago. Product of unacceptable quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: I bought 3 of these and first 2 were fine but on the third unit the prongs to plug ...
customer_reviews.text: Major quality control issue, be careful. I bought 3 of these and first 2 were fine but on the third unit the prongs to plug into the outlet were only about 1/8" long because it was not assembled correctly. How this ever got past quality control and put in the package is amazing knowing this came from First Alert. I missed the return window so shame on me, and out $30, but maybe this will help someone else save $30.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Says low battery when I have new batterie in. The alarm came with two AA Duracell batteries. So I took those out and replaced with new ones. Then come to find out it’s written on the alarm that you can only use energizer batteries! So why would the company send Duracell?
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Low cost alternative for building compliance
customer_reviews.text: Our township recently passed a new ordinance regarding the presence of CO detectors in businesses. The fire marshal made it clear that it didn't need to be something expensive or hard wired, so long as it worked. These plug in detectors were the perfect solution for our needs. They are easy to read, required no complicated programming, and have a battery backup in the event of a power outage. The three pack gave us coverage for the entire office to get us in compliance.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Not what I got
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was defective. When the batteries were placed there was a gap between connections so it would not work on battery power alone. On top of this, when I contacted the manufacturer, they could not locate this model number and she speculated it "must be an old model." She was helpful and pointed me towards a newer similar model on Amazon. Shady experience. Should have researched more instead of blindly trusting "Amazon Recommended"
customer_reviews.author: Vanhoff

customer_reviews.title: easy setup but be mindful of size
customer_reviews.text: the product itself is great, nice gentle blue backlight and pretty intuitive. really appreciate the CO detector, especially around our gas fireplace. I did have to be mindful where I placed, as the unit is about a good 1.5-2" deep and 4-5" wide. It will block the other outlet in a standard plug, so you'll need to plug in to the bottom outlet. I also couldn't keep it behind the couch as it would make an indent in the back of the couch. So size aside, great purchase and really enjoy the peace of mind
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Detectors made in China in 2015. 3 years on Warranty already expired. Not good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the 2 Detectors today. Seen where they were made in China on 2015. This being 2018 looks like 3 years of the 7 year warranty has already expired. Amazon needs to advise customers when these were made (year). Have yet to plug them in, so cannot yet rate how good they are. Disappointed in Amazon for advertising 7 year warranty when Detectors were made in 2015. Maybe this is why they were sold at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...returned
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 pack monitor to replace my old monitor of the same brand. Installation seem pretty easy and it came with the backup battery but the problem was that the compartment where the battery sits has a door which closes with a simple latch and it JUST would not close. I tried several things and tried to adjust it but did not work. I even sent an email to the seller but did not receive a response. I did not even open the second one and returned the product through Amazon. I will try another model
customer_reviews.author: KRiSP

customer_reviews.title: Sold an old product
customer_reviews.text: I am really annoyed that the date of this detector is November 20, 2014. There is a 7 year limited manufacture warranty and I am already over one year into it on the day I receive the item. I am seriously considering making a return of this product. Also there was a price change by Amazon after I made the purchase, the price dropped by 17%.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a strange headache when we turned the heat on did some research ordered this was all fine for four days got extra cold a few nights ago so I turned the thermostat up to 80 degrees and went to sleep woke up dizzy and tired to a loud sounding alarm at 1a.m when me and my wife went downstairs the alarm was going off and said to evacuate the area turns out our chimney was completely clogged and our boiler and water heater were unable to vent outside amazing product possibly saved our lives
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: These product is defective upon arrival. No manufacturer date. I followed the setup instruction to the teeth. It just doesn't go anywhere. The display just keep displaying defective batteries even new one are installed. Have to returned items to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Ng

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to install, good instructions
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty impressed. I especially appreciate the design options of direct plug-in or extension plug-in. Everything is onboard. All you must do is open the package, install the two AA batteries and plug it directly into a non-switched outlet. It is all ready for a vertical outlet and changing for a horizontal outlet only requires changing the direction of the transformer. Unless you need to hang the unit on the wall away from the outlet, just leave the coiled wire right where it is.
customer_reviews.author: Dunwoodytoolman

customer_reviews.title: Keeps going off!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this carbon monoxide monitor when we moved into our first home. It worked great for 2-3 months and then one night it kept beeping. We reset it several times and each time it went straight up to 400 and the screen read "evacuate". We called the fire department who came out and tested several areas, all of which showed no carbon monoxide. Ever since then it has been beeping on occasion telling us "error" or "evacuate" but we never know if it's accurate now that it's had so many errors. We will need to buy another one from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi Pike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but very bulky looking
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and to setup using included batteries. Sits well on the provided wall wart and can be just plugged in. However, it sits very proud from the wall (about 2 1/2") and looks (and is) quite bulky. From the pictures it doesn't look like it, and there are no measurements on the listing (only the package's dimensions). Especially with the recommended installation height of 4', one would expect it to be better looking. I installed one in the hallway next to my Nest, choosing safety over style, but it's annoying every time I see the two together.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Reliable protection
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, I've never had this alarm go off "for real" so you can rely on the other reviewers with that experience for their comments about accuracy. I've had mine for 7 years and 8 months, and just started getting the error message saying it's past its service life. That's 8 months more than the 7 year warranty, so I'm happy. And, amazingly, it costs the same as the one I bought in November 2012.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Is it working or not?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these First Alert Carbon Monoxide detectors in August of 2018. It is now November of 2018 (2 weeks after the product support period ended) and the green LED light on one of the units which tells you it is plugged in and working has gone out. Now I cannot tell if the unit is on or not - is it protecting me or not?
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Install
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these detectors two times. One time for my house and one time for my mother's home. The detectors are easy to install. Just add the batteries and plug them into an outlet. They are small and discreet. My detectors came three to a package. I installed in the basement, first floor and second floor. You can test the detector to make sure it works. (It did!) Other than that, you do not need to think about them. Thankfully, my detectors have been silent, but it is comforting to know they will do their job if there is a problem with carbon monoxide. I though the price was a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Better One!
customer_reviews.text: There's really no point to paying extra for the digital display. On this unit it does not tell what the CO2 level is unless it's set off the alarm. We have a kiddie one that lights up with a 0, so you know it's safe. This is also only a 7 year model. It's a actually cheaper in the long run to get the kiddie 10 year model. Also in our state anything that's expired has to be replaced or you cannot sell your house.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: They make them expire after 5 years. With Technology these days instead of getting what you pay for, you get ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Suderbooter

customer_reviews.title: Saved my mother's life yesterday
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these 4 months ago 2 for my new home and one for my mothers. It has been tested at my mother's home and thank god she is alive to let me know they work. The alarm of this detector was going off before the Kidde carbon monoxide detector
customer_reviews.author: MzThomas

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this detector because a (I now know disreputable) furnace guy said I had CO issues with my furnace, and that it needed to be replaced' . The one good recommendation he made was to buy a good CO detector that would display peak CO levels detected. Well, I took that advice, installing this one and a detector of similar capability made by another company. Both detectors have been running for 2 weeks now, and both read a peak level of 0 ppm of CO. The fraud is busted. More importantly I avoided a $5000 expense. Most important: my family is safe. P.S. : Installation flexibility is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and I have no clue if it really works
customer_reviews.text: and I hope I never have to find out. My previous CO detectors expired and needed replacement so after some research I decided to purchase these. I bought two. One is in the master bedroom and the other is in a hallway outside two other sleeping rooms. They were very easy to install. Simply unpackage them, the hardest part, insert the batteries and plug them in and push the test button. I assume and hope they work but since I don't know I only gave them four stars.
customer_reviews.author: GaryS1964

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Are my old one crapped out on me after about eight years. I think this is a newer version of the one that I had. Consumer reports likes it, works great, and hasn't gone off yet thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The right detector for your kitchen with gas appliances
customer_reviews.text: We previously had a combination CO2 / smoke detector in our kitchen. The problem was that when we cook we would never know for sure if it was being set off by our smoke/heat/fire from cooking (somewhat common for us) or if our gas oven/broiler was producing CO2 (A real problem). Installing this in our kitchen we now know that we do not have a CO2 problem and we can let the smoke detectors in other rooms sound the alarm for smoke/fire/heat. This detector has a screen that displays the peak CO2 since last reset. It is reassuring to see that ours is still at 0 ppm after operating for several weeks. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-up
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a good size--fits in a small area and only covers one outlet. The display is very clear also. Installing batteries (as back-up) is very easy. When I pressed the test button, it was loud and clear. The only problem I have with it, is that the tiny green "working" light is very hard to see; it's kind of hidden.
customer_reviews.author: ASkal

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this product. The batteries don’t fit for the battery back-up. There seems to be a piece of plastic that is too large and in the way. The first one I ordered was fine but the second and third had this issue. It’s annoying to go through the return process for a defective item!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Syroka

customer_reviews.title: Lasted past it’s warranty period
customer_reviews.text: We have had this CO detector for a while and it started beeping 5 times today to notify us it was at end of life and needs to be replaced. It has a 7 year warranty and I noticed I ordered it from Amazon back in May of 2012 so it almost made it 8 years. I’d say that’s pretty good. Never had it go off so either it doesn’t work or we never needed it to go off. Only maintenance on it during those 8 years was to replace the AA batteries a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: J. Horrom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Certainly this is easy to install. You just plug it into the wall. I do not understand why they offer installation at over a hundred dollars. Ridiculous. However, I could not get the screen to stay blue, which it did on my previous device, also First Alert. That is disappointing. The test shows that it is working but I am not happy that the blue light doesn't stay on. I phoned Amazon.com to see if they could help me get the product working properly and they offered to refund the purchase price because I was an unhappy consumrer. Their customer service was excellent and I got an email the next day confirming the refund. Bravo to Amazon.!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great device, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Relatively small size, (the horizontal shape allows you to use the second recepticle in your wall outlet). 7 year life. The CO monitor on the front is really not necessary, but a nice feature. Comes with batteries for power failure back-up.
customer_reviews.author: NorthShoreBooks

customer_reviews.title: Must buy and install.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. Obviously with daily TV stories about house being burned down due to lack of Co or smoke detector seems to be heart breaking. Despite the fact we have several detectors wired through our security system, this highly visible one upstairs and in the basement close to utility room gives an assurance that no major disaster will occur. Besides, First Alert is a well known brand.
customer_reviews.author: usdoc1ga

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a 10 yr old unit that stopped working. This unit is a much updated version. Works well so far
customer_reviews.author: PC/MAC USER

customer_reviews.title: Good plug in model.
customer_reviews.text: I like this model because I can plug it in. It also has a battery backup. The digital display is really nice. It’s a good piece of mind that I can manually check the CO level. The plug can also detach from the back so you can plug it in but mount up higher if desired.
customer_reviews.author: S. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell its on from a distance.
customer_reviews.text: I'd prefer if the blue backlight would stay on with the zero reading, especially when plugged in. I want to be able to glance from across the garage to make sure its at least powered on--if its supposed to alert me to a silent killer, give me some passive indication its on!! There is a battery indicator but its only visible up close and still doesn't give me the assurance that a "zero" indication would.
customer_reviews.author: TheLastAndTheCurious

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I use it in my mechanic shop. Some cars can run for 30 minutes before making enough CO2 to set it off but some older cars make 400PPM CO2 in 2 minutes. This thing has saved my life countless numbers of times.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes Autos Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Had to get a replacement for one of the two units
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing the two existing CO detectors with the exact same model after they hit end-of-life (they beep when they need to be replaced). The old ones lasted the advertised 7 years (maybe close to 8). One of the two new units would not self-test correctly (failed the test sequence and would not sound the alarm). Amazon, as usual, was efficient and quick in remedying the situation. Rather than have me send the two units back (one working and being used; one defective), they sent me another two-pack as replacement. Thanks, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery and Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these to go in each bedroom. They arrived in two days. They install very easily. You put in the two batteries that come with the monitor and then plug it into the wall. I may never know if they work but they came quickly and installed easily. It gives me peace of mind to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dual power makes this CO Alarm very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Dual power makes this CO Alarm very versatile. I used it to replace a battery powered alarm. I even installed a new electrical outlet so that I could take advantage of the duality and keep the alarm in the original location. I test it occasionally. Like any form of insurance, I'm glad it's there, but hope I never really need it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle reader from NY

customer_reviews.title: FEEL MORE SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, battery back-up. Nice that the units can be mounted in an outlet close to the floor as that is where the CO settles as it displaces O2. Haven't had any false alarms (or ANY alarms) but test both units regularly: one upstairs one in basement. Feel safer with these combined with my smoke detectors. These units are very highly rated by Consumer Reports: read the online reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, high Consumer Reports rating.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. Very highly rated by Consumer Reports. My first one displayed "End of Life" after 7.5 years and had to be thrown away. I'm surprised by this feature. Does the sensor REALLY degrade over time, or is this a preprogrammed ploy to get you to spend more money by being forced to replace it?
customer_reviews.author: AtomsForEnergy

customer_reviews.title: Nice 3-pack
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2-story house plus a basement so I needed 3 CO detectors. So this 3-pack was perfect. There is obviously no way to know if they really work without actually having a CO leak, but I trust the First Alert brand. I like that they use cheaper AA batteries for backup power vs 9V like my old detectors.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ames

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: As a firefighter I bought this pack of 3. 1 for my home and 1 for each of my 2 kids homes. Great deal. Like buying 2 and getting 1 free. Happy with purchase. Seem to work as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Tim from Iowa

customer_reviews.title: There is a cord
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this product, so its too soon to review it, but this is a response to all the Answered Questions with answers that say there is no cord, just plug it in. Actually the AC power comes from a little cube that snaps into the back of the housing. This cube can be removed and separated from the housing by about 6 feet. I have seen this same arrangement in other brands of CO detectors.
customer_reviews.author: T. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Quality detector
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, this is an important purchase for anyone. So I'd recommend you read multiple reviews, not just one. Here's mine..... + Bold, clear display + Loud enough to hear from anywhere in my house, including the basement + Backup battery + Small enough to cover only the bottom outlet plug, so you can use the top one for something else - If you want it installed at head level (or any level other than the outlet), you have to mount it on the wall and always look at the unsightly cord
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S.

customer_reviews.title: Order two, both show on and test ok but do not actually work
customer_reviews.text: Held against major co emitting source, does not register after 5 minutes or alarm. Absolute junk. Sending back. Im quickly losing my faith in humanity on everyone built / sold from China as it all appears to never work as advertised or for very long. There are no alternatives and that should scare the daylights out of everyone
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to a Battery-only CO monitor
customer_reviews.text: After having 3 CO monitors (with supposedly 10-year life lithium battery) fail due to dead batteries within 2-3 years of use, I did not want another lithium battery CO monitor. This plug-in CO monitor is great as it uses AA batteries as back-up if there is a power failure. My only complaint about this CO monitor is that its height as it does stick out of the wall a lot more than other CO monitors.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased several of these for rental properties and was recently able to use one to locate a cracked heat exchanger on a furnace. There are four furnaces in that basement and the digital readout helped us find the defective one. The readout doesn't activate until the levels reach 30 ppm, but after that it can be used similar to a handheld meter. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: NATALIE

customer_reviews.title: Good brand
customer_reviews.text: I've been using First Alert detectors for more than 30 years. They have always been reliable and last for years. My old detector started beeping and showed END on the display. It was time replace it so I bought this one. It has a display that shows levels of carbon monoxide detected.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Not for Continuos Readout
customer_reviews.text: Returned this unit because I wanted a continuos reading without pushing any buttons, if I have to push a button I probably end up not doing it. Also found out this unit doesn't do readout not after it passes 30 ppm and doesn't alarm until it reaches 70 ppm after 60(?) minutes. I have 3 major gas-fire appliances inside my home and don't want to take any chances, plus being a number guy makes me feel better to look at a continuos display. Got me one of those low level detector DEFENDER at 5x the cost but starts displaying at 5 ppm and alarms sooner, probably an overkill but I just need to know what's happening in my own home.
customer_reviews.author: bobb

customer_reviews.title: Clevery designed, little monitor
customer_reviews.text: Much prefer this detector to the ones we previously had. It is smaller and better-looking than the old ones (important considering they are sticking out of the wall is rather prominent places) and love the option of using the cord in the socket and mounting the device on the wall (since we have one socket that won't accommodate the monitor itself). Also love the front-loading battery compartment. So far we have had no monoxide issues so I do not know whether it actually functions but I have confidence it does.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Clever with battery backup
customer_reviews.text: I love the battery backup plus it can plug into the wall AC as a "Wall wort". The clever thing is the AC connection is detachable from the device and there is a coil of power wire allowing to strch the unit away from the AC wall plug. It also came with Drywall anchor and screws, Which I did not use. I just plugged it in.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with this product and would recommend it's purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased First Alert products in the past with satisfaction in the quality. I think these (and smoke detectors) are a very wise purchase. Be sure to read the directions. Watch for placement of the unit. You don't want to place it too close to the furnace or too close to the ceiling or too close to the floor. You'll also want to make sure nothing blocks it (like furniture). I'm pleased with this product and would recommend it's purchase.
customer_reviews.author: vls

customer_reviews.title: Just like others have stated this unit installs quickly and when ...
customer_reviews.text: Just like others have stated this unit installs quickly and when tested functions perfectly. I have had it almost two months and it has not gone off which is good! I read the instructions and then plugged ours into floor outlets and the installation was without issue. There have been no false alarms and I test them each month. So far I am pleased and like what I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my house and one for traveling. Most places you stay at do not have carbon monoxide detectors in them so this is great for travel. They are small and plug right into a normal outlet. Safety is important!!! Unfortunately, I forgot my travel one at a place I stayed and didn't realize it until I wanted to use it again!!! :-(......I'll be buying another soon!!!
customer_reviews.author: rlhinca

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The batteries (that came with the unit) do not fit in the battery compartment properly for the end of one battery to be in contact with the metal strip at one end. There is a piece of plastic manufactured into unit that blocks the battery from contacting the metal it needs to touch. The unit is inoperable. Baffling. Getting a call back tomorrow from customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hansen

customer_reviews.title: It works as testing goes so far but I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: It works as testing goes so far but I don't think I'll everreally need it there's no smoking in the house, I use an electric oven and stove, microwave oven so only gas is used for drying clothes. The water heater is in the garage. It's the law in Southern California for all houses you must have at least one in the house I have 2 b/c I have 2 floors both are located in the hallways.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gust

customer_reviews.title: They had lasted the exact time specified in the documents and I was comfortable purchasing an identical replacement
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks ago the carbon monoxide alarm in my house started beeping (a recent home purchase). After going online to research the make and model of alarm and what the code meant, I discovered it had come to its 'end of life'. They had lasted the exact time specified in the documents and I was comfortable purchasing an identical replacement. The dual power is convenient as you not relying on only one power source and the LCD readout is easily visible. This product has a very good consumer rating and I am a happy owner.
customer_reviews.author: emzbiz

customer_reviews.title: Until it is tested under fire - no way to tell.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure the purpose of this review. Simple to install - put in backup batteries, plug it in, and test. The alarm worked, the proper display showed. For that I give four stars. However the only thing that matters is - Does it work when it has to? No way to tell, unless, and until there is a Carbon Monoxide event. If that happens and it alerts me in time, I will be happy to give this item 5 stars. Other than that a review is meaningless.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Robert

customer_reviews.title: Improved Model, Same Protection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to replace an older model that functioned well beyond the number of years specified. The current model is easier to read, more compact and has replaceable batteries. I trust the First Alert brand-name to protect my household and highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: ls

customer_reviews.title: ... with my water heater I decided it would be good to have a CO monitor
customer_reviews.text: After a burner problem with my water heater I decided it would be good to have a CO monitor. This one does the job. It was manufactured in 2017 and has a good warranty. Installation was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Philip H. Ness

customer_reviews.title: Power Cord does not work for one of two purchased.
customer_reviews.text: One of two purchased functions perfectly plugged directly into a shoulder-height outlet in my basement. The other one will not function with the power cord, and drains the battery power pretty quickly... kind of frustrating having to replace the batteries several times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Rossell

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Its a brand name that I have purchased before. I did not rate the accuracy because I have no way of checking it. The price was good, shipping was timely and accurate and I think every home should have these and fire/smoke alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Terry581

customer_reviews.title: A necessary monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older one that has expired and needed replaced. I like the idea of being able to plug it in and then you are able to extend it where ever you want to place it. It has worked fine and I feel safe once again having something that has several years before needing replaced again. It is reasonably priced and does what is needed to protect my safety.
customer_reviews.author: DRM43

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, has excellent lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Bought the last version, since redesigned with a different chipboard which is not only enhanced for sensitivity but also has extended longevity. The version I purchased had a 5 year warranty, now extended with new design to 7 years, and it was VERY reliable for 6 and a half years. According to manufacturer its lifetime was within the range for design. The plugin feature is very convenient and batteries never had to be replaced. Nice product with US customer service easy to contact by telephone. They make cheaper battery operated versions, but based on my experience the battery cost savings, reliability and longevity justify the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: It gives me a peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and put one in the kitchen and another one in my son’s room. When I tested it out the beeping is loud enough that anyone would be able to hear it from anywhere in the house. I also like that it has a backup battery, so I don’t have to worry about it when the power is out. I’m satisfied with the item so far and it gives me a peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: TC. Hon

customer_reviews.title: Good CO detector
customer_reviews.text: Had ordered another brands CO detector that was highly rate here on amazon and it was terrible; false readings repeatedly, in particular at 2 am just to make my next work day miserable. Returned that and ordered this and has been perfect so far! Easy plug in and go set up. I have had this for a few months now so can’t speak for long term reliability but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P.

customer_reviews.title: High-pitched whine
customer_reviews.text: Makes a constant, high-pitched whining noise that is faintly audible at 10+ feet away. May not be a problem for everyone, but drove me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Smart looking, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item mostly because of the dual power. It is very modern looking and the test tone was quite loud. It shows the status of the battery while it is plugged into an outlet, and the icon flashes if you loose AC power. There is a nice blue light that illuminates when you are checking status buttons however it goes out afterwards as to not be an anoyance in a dark bedroom of livingroom. No regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Auger77

customer_reviews.title: Uses Batteries, but ONLY Works Plugged-In
customer_reviews.text: I saw it was a plug-in device, but since it says it comes with batteries, I assumed it would work solely on batteries (like all other CO detectors). Most houses and apartments I've ever lived in, 90% of outlets are close to the floor (except for maybe the kitchen), not the ideal placement for a gas detector.
customer_reviews.author: alexdbz4

customer_reviews.title: Working for me!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on several different brands and decided that First Alert carbon monoxide detectors were the best. Of course, the only way I will ever know if it works is if it goes off. At least I sleep better at night knowing it is in the house and sniffing for poisonous gas, carbon monoxide!
customer_reviews.author: Quanah

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, packaged well. The only problem I had and still do is after installing the battery the door would not stay shut. Had to use a small piece if tape to hold the door closed. Since I purchased 2 the problem is the same on both. Should have returned them but since they are not visable decided to accept as they are. Of course this will be a big influence on the purchase of future First Alert products.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not good for older furnaces
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat reading found to be 5 degrees too warm by my HVAC professional during my yearly furnace check. The reading is 5 degrees off. Unit only allows .5 degree variance vs. set temperature so The thermostat heat cycles the furnace every 10 minutes and runs for only 2-3 minutes to maintain set temperature. I have an older furnace an would prefer a variance of 1-2 degrees vs. the set temperature to put less strain on my furnace—I.e. run fewer times an hour for longer durations each cycle. Forget trying to contact Honeywell...no one picks up. $70 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Helen B.

customer_reviews.title: This was very east to install and use
customer_reviews.text: Great to just plugin or mount on a ceiling. Avoides having to clutter your ceiling or walls with a separate smoke detector and CO alert. Did it easily myself, no handyman required (especially to plug it in!).
customer_reviews.author: TFarwell

customer_reviews.title: I really like the display on this one
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with carbon monoxide, but I have several different detectors around, hoping one of them will catch it if I do. I really like the display on this one, which tells me what the level is at, and the battery display makes me feel better too. I like that it has 2 methods of power - battery and a power cord - so if the electricity goes out for an extended period of time, it will still alert you. Whether or not it works is hard to tell, but I'm more comfortable being able to see a display working than not having any way to tell if it's even powered.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: bought before; bought a 2nd one; will buy again
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time I bought this. the place where I live states by law that CO detectors are mandatory, and that they are required to be AC and also have battery backup. this seems to do the job (actually, I dnno, I never had the alarm go off, and random checks of the level never showed anything... maybe it's only a rock that keeps tigers away, after all...) anyway: - inexpensive - comes with batteries - 7 year lifetime - plugs directly into wall socket - or, you can unwrap the power cable and mount it away from the wall socket
customer_reviews.author: Henzo Broquee

customer_reviews.title: Just saved a life. There wasn’t one in basement ...
customer_reviews.text: Just saved a life. There wasn’t one in basement so I installed this one. We had a mass exhaust leak on the furnace last week and this went off alerting my wife to the problem. She was able to get out of the house and have a repairman come to get it fixed. Could have turned out way different.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to setup.  Notice "kpa" in setup
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great, and it is very accurate. It was easy to setup, and easy to read. I only had one issue setting it up. The last setting is in very small print, so small I missed it. It read "kpa," so treading was 16.1 over 11.1. Set it up again saw the little letters and looked it up. Set it for mmHg, (only used in USA) and 122 over 81. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: I never hear its alarm
customer_reviews.text: I guess by writing this I can say it works well since I'm alive and it hasn't gone off telling us we are about to die. That's a good sign right? It's a product you don't want to interact with on a regular basis. According to the instructions I installed it right and the test button says it's working so let's hope I never hear its alarm.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kroepfl

customer_reviews.title: Lighted display only shows when you press and hold the button.
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that the display only lights up when you are pressing and holding the button down pretty hard. I thought it would have the light blue display all of the time (like in the photo) and mine does not; so it is difficult to read since it is always dark. I have to pull it out of the wall socket and press the button to get a reading.
customer_reviews.author: Mary - Hockessin, DE

customer_reviews.title: We have four of them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace four other units in front of every bedroom. We have never had an alarm and hope we never have the need to. This isn't a nice to have, get them and place them according to instructions. They could save your life.
customer_reviews.author: ? with everything

customer_reviews.title: Random beeps...
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these. One appears to be fine. The second one beeps randomly for no reason. There are three short beeps that are about as loud as a battery warning beep (not too loud, but enough to be very annoying). It beeps randomly. It might beep two or three times in one day, and than not beep again for a week. CO readings are always zero. Replacing the new battery doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work correctly
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be just fine. Does not constantly show CO levels, but you can push the button and see the readings over last 24hr. The instructions indicate it resets every 24hr. Nice that you can plug it in directly to the outlet or with the 6 foot extension. Definitely read directions for where you should and should not mount this (e.g. NOT in a room with combustion like a furnace or gas boiler)
customer_reviews.author: P3t3r P

customer_reviews.title: Missed the return deadline unfortunately as I would have liked my money back
customer_reviews.text: Window to insert the battery never opened and closed properly. Was leaving for vacation and needed it though so took it anyway. After only a couple times of taking the battery in/out (for plane flights), the latch broke alltogether and had to tape it up for the rest of the trip. Missed the return deadline unfortunately as I would have liked my money back. Poor design and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. My old CO2 alarm had reached the end of its 10 year life, so this is its replacement. So far I love it, the best feature being that it plugs into an outlet rather than having to be hard wired or relying solely on battery power (like my old one). I have this one in my kitchen, just a couple of feet from my gas range, and even though First Alert recommends not placing it too close to gas appliances (due to the possibility of false alarms), I have had no false alarm issues from having mine in close proximity to the range.
customer_reviews.author: kepi

customer_reviews.title: We haven't died yet
customer_reviews.text: I'm guessing this works. I don't think I've had a gas leak, but maybe we have. I can say with some confidence that I haven't died yet, & this has been in my house for several months.
customer_reviews.author: Dale kern

customer_reviews.title: A pretty blue hue is cast; I don't know if unit works.
customer_reviews.text: I asked a question about this item and sent an unanswered email. It gets 2 stars because I don't know if it works properly, based on the numbers and beeps shown and heard, respectively when I first activated it. So, it sets in the wall, plugged in, silent for now.
customer_reviews.author: OneryPrincessTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Not the most fun $30
customer_reviews.text: This device is pretty standard, you plug it into the wall and if there's too much CO, it should alarm. I was expecting the digital display to show a real-time CO level in the room. I thought that would be kind of cool. However, the digital display is blank unless the alarm goes off, in which case it will tell you how much CO is being detected (so you know how severe the CO concentration is, whether you should totally evacuate the house or if you can just open a couple windows). Otherwise it seems like a pretty standard detector.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clausen

customer_reviews.title: Battery sucker
customer_reviews.text: This detector eats through batteries fast. I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Not dead yet...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t died of carbon monoxide yet, so I guess it’s working. Just plug it into a wall outlet. That’s it. It is a chunky little bastard so if you don’t have a lot of space it may be an issue. Just check the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: PruFin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't alert us of gas, gas was blowing directly on detector.
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked up gas hot water tank and held the detector over a blowing gas line and it never beeped or did anything. Possibly a faulty detector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the two I bought is defective.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. One of them the batteries never stay in place which causes the device to beep. Very annoying. Wish it worked like the other one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice look. Easy to see, considering you have to bend over to see what it's telling you. They all tested well. Happy with them. 6 months later they have not changed color (yet). Often the older these type things are, the more "beige" they turn. Do read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: topazgirl

customer_reviews.title: Battery Zapper
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with the CO detector, mostly because it goes through batteries like crazy. We've had this for 1 year and have had to replace the batteries every 2 months. We've used different kinds of batteries, but none have lasted much more than 2 months. I will be shopping for a new CO detector and tossing this chirping piece in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Falls out of wall
customer_reviews.text: Won't stay in the outlets. Had to shuffle them around to find a good fit but not confident it will stay plugged in. Guessing they will drain the battery fast. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Chemical leak
customer_reviews.text: There is this dark smudge on the inside back part of my unit, and I don't know what it is. I think it's dried, but some of it got on the wrapper that the cable comes in, so it was definitely wet at some point. Either way, can anyone please tell me what this mark is or is from? Is it some type of leak from the unit? Is this safe? Should I return the unit? I'm afraid to use it out of fear of a chemical leak. The CO615 is an electrochemical model, so I figured a leak is very reasonable to have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Top Rated By CR
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several of these units to replace Kidde units after 7-8 years, at which time they often fail or should be replaced. The First Alert unit is much smaller compact and has a nice display. Highly recommend this unit for a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: VA Tech Hokie

customer_reviews.title: Happy Happy Joy Joy
customer_reviews.text: Happy Happy Joy Joy! It was just as it was advertised, so it gets four stars, what else is there to say! They would get five stars if they went above and beyond what was advertised and expected. Imagine if your grocery store was like this and you had to rate every product you purchased! How annoying would that be?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Happy Joy Joy

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if it worked out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 5 of these to cover two houses. The first unit I tried was completely dead from AC or batteries and the second only ran from batteries. The wall outlet was good so the problem was with the devices. I didn't even bother with the remaining 3 and just returned all of them. Maybe I had bad luck with this batch of detectors but I'll be looking at the Kidde instead since my previous devices were from them. Luckily Amazon makes returns extremely easy...
customer_reviews.author: Steven

product_meta.title: First Alert Dual-Power Carbon Monoxide Detector Alarm | Plug-In with Battery Backup and Digital Display, CO615
product_meta.description:
Style:Plug in Alarm with Digital Display| Size:1 packThe First Alert CO615 dual power carbon monoxide plug in alarm alerts you to dangerous carbon monoxide. This carbon monoxide detector operates on a dual power system with battery backup for continuous monitoring, even in the event of a power outage. The backlit digital screen tells you at a glance what the carbon monoxide and power Levels Are. The Co monitor also features a convenient test and silence button and an end of life timer that lets you know when it is time to replace the unit.*ensure the outlet has power.*the battery is for back up only and is not intended to power the alarm for an Extended period of time in the absence of AC. *the alarm will light up the display briefly to indicate the unit is receiving power. *press and hold test button to ensure activation.

AMAZON.COM
Carbon monoxide (CO) is the leading cause of accidental poisoning deaths in America, yet many people don't know they are suffering from CO poisoning until its too late. Since symptoms of CO poisoning are like the flu, you might not even know you're in danger at first. That's why a carbon monoxide alarm is an excellent way to protect your family. It can detect the CO you can't see, smell or taste in the air.

 The First Alert CO615 carbon monoxide alarm uses an electrochemical carbon monoxide sensor-the most accurate technology available. Installation is as simple as plugging it in to any wall outlet. Its easy-to-read backlit digital LED display gives you a clear read-out of current CO concentrations in parts per million. The alarm includes a battery back-up giving you peace of mind in a power outage. The test/silence button both silences a non-threatening alarm or low battery warning and allows you to test the unit's functionality. The unit monitors and re-alarms if carbon monoxide levels persist sounding a loud 85-decibel horn. An audible and visual low battery signal alerts you to replace the battery and an indicator alerts you when a battery has been removed. An end-of-life alarm of three chirps alerts you to replace the unit. Two AA batteries are included. 7-year limited warranty. UL listed. --Bree Norlander

What's in the Box 
One carbon monoxide alarm, two AA batteries, and user's manual
feature_bullets: Keep your family safe with this digital display, plug in carbon monoxide alarm; It works with any standard outlet and also has a battery backup for continuous monitoring of Carbon Monoxide levels, even if there's a power failure
Features an advanced electrochemical carbon monoxide sensor; Peak level feature displays the highest concentration of carbon monoxide measured
A loud 85 decibel alarm sounds when Carbon Monoxide levels reach dangerous levels
To ensure complete protection make sure to place one on each level of your home and in each bedroom
7 year limited warranty; Equipped with end of life signal chirp, so you know when it’s time to replace the unit for safety
All first alert CO alarms are rigorously tested to meet UL standards
First Alert has been the most trusted brand in home safety since launching the first residential smoke alarm in 1958 (Based on a First Alert Brand Trust Survey in February 2018)

specifications.Style: Plug in Alarm with Digital Display
specifications.Included Components: One Carbon Monoxide Alarm, User Manual, First Alert Co615 Dual Power Carbon Monoxide Plug-In Alarm, 2-Aa Batteries
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,733 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
